articles.title: Celebrini, McDavid, Mackinnon team up for white-knuckle win 3-2 over Finland: Cult of Hockey Player Grades
articles.description: Team Canada erased a 2-0 deficit, roaring back for a 3-2 win over Finland and a berth in the Olympic Gold medal game. articles.title: Pre-budget consultations: Quebec community organizations need additional $2.6B
articles.description: As part of pre-budget consultations, independent community action groups are asking the Quebec government to inject significantly more funding into their overall mission, as demand for services has skyrocketed since the pandemic. articles.title: Metadata Exposes Authors of ICE’s ‘Mega’ Detention Center Plans
articles.description: Comments and other data left on a PDF detailing Homeland Security’s proposal to build “mega” detention and processing centers reveal the personnel involved in its creation.

articles.title: Great news for xAI: Grok is now pretty good at answering questions about Baldur’s Gate
articles.description: A new report from Business Insider reveals that high-level engineers at xAI were pulled off other projects to make sure Grok could answer detailed questions about the video game Baldur's Gate.

articles.title: Canada advances to gold-medal game by a skate blade in 3-2 win over Finland
articles.description: On the game-winning goal scored by Nathan MacKinnon on the power play with 36 seconds to play in regulation, Finland challenged that the play was offside. The ruling on ice stood upon review.

articles.description: Quebec Solidaire (QS) parliamentary leader Ruba Ghazal is defending her colleague Haroun Bouazzi, who claims that the National Assembly is a toxic environment where “lying, manipulation, and intimidation” are part of everyday life. articles.title: Bloc MP says he was mugged and pepper-sprayed while in Brussels for NATO visit
articles.description: OTTAWA — A Bloc Québécois member of Parliament says he was assaulted and pepper-sprayed this week while in Brussels for a NATO parliamentary assembly meeting. articles.description: Homicide investigators say 48-year-old Kristopher Benson of Chilliwack was shot dead inside a residence on Sunday.

articles.description: Montreal will add basic services to some sites, and will relocate others if there are safety concerns.

articles.title: Premier Smith can’t quantify savings from Alberta referendum proposals on immigration

articles.title: Ukrainian man jailed for identity theft that helped North Koreans get jobs at US companies
articles.description: A Ukrainian man has been sentenced for helping North Koreans gain fraudulent employment at dozens of U.S. companies and funnel that money back to the regime to fund its nuclear weapons program.
